Specifying a Grammar

In the simplest case, recognition can be performed on one gesture at a time. This technique is known as isolated gesture recognition. However, sometimes it is necessary to perform continuous recognition on a sequence of gestures within a contiguous block of data. Knowledge of the possible sequences of gestures can be presented to GTk in the form of a rule-based or stochastic grammar. Grammars allow GTk to leverage knowledge about the structure of data, which aids in continuous recognition by using previously classified gestures to constrain the current gesture classification. Grammars also allow users to define complex gestures as a sequence of simpler gestures.
